item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Monday, December 9, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. I can now run a GPT-4 class model on my laptop (35 points | 10 comments)
2. Reducing CO₂ emissions with faster software (10 points | 6 comments)
3. Compromising OpenWrt Supply Chain via Truncated SHA-256 Collision and Command Injection (38 points | 4 comments)

5. How to Think About Time (18 points | 6 comments)
6. Douglas Crockford Is Not Your Dad (62 points | 70 comments)
7. Memory-safe PNG decoders now vastly outperform C PNG libraries (10 points | no comments)
8. The rule of least client-side complexity (10 points | 5 comments)
9. Himalaya, CLI to manage emails: v1.0.0 (2 points | 1 comment)
10. What are you doing this week? (9 points | 35 comments)
11. Parsing MIDI messages in Rust (6 points | 2 comments)
12. What are the Magical Clocks for? (4 points | no comments)
13. TOML for configuration (3 points | 4 comments)
14. Rust Futures are not guaranteed to be lazy (5 points | no comments)
15. Apple’s use of Swift and SwiftUI in iOS 18 (4 points | no comments)
16. Parsing millions of URLs per second (4 points | no comments)
17. C has its limits. If you know where to look (2 points | no comments)
18. Dual_EC_DRBG with Justin Schuh and Matthew Green (4 points | no comments)
19. Protected mode support in the original Windows 3.0 was basically a 1-man skunkworks project (34 points | 25 comments)
20. qutebrowser: A keyboard-driven, vim-like browser based on Python and Qt (22 points | 7 comments)
21. Data structures as jigs for programmers (Go edition) (7 points | no comments)
22. Incremental TT Munchers (1 points | no comments)
23. Should std::expected be [[nodiscard]]? (10 points | 4 comments)
24. How do I pay the publisher of a web page? (16 points | 7 comments)
25. testing/synctest experiment for time and concurrency testing (6 points | 4 comments)
